titleStmt.title: A conference of some Christians in church-fellow-ship, about the way of Christ with his people, and the result therefrom. This serveth only by way of introduction to take off the reproaches, that are cast upon pastour and people, whose earnest care and endeavour is to walke with a right foote in that holy way. Which is held forth here by the light of the sacred Scripture, as it appeares unto them, and how curious and circumspect their walke should be, who pretend to it, and to walke therein. The scandalls in and against the way are removed as they could be.
titleStmt.author: Woodward, Ezekias, 1590-1675.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed according to order for Henry Cripps, in Popes-head-Alley.,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "By Hezek: Woodward. ffeb: 13".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
